description: Jack Power and Franklin Richards take a wild trip through the timestream and end up face-to-face with a pre-teen Wolverine! But since young James Howlett is nothing at all like the hero he is destined to one day become, it'll be up to our time-tossed troublemakers to teach the once-and-future- Wolvie how to kick some butt! Plus... MINI MARVELS!
name: Jack & Frank's Excellent Adventure

description: From Gilbert Hernandez, the award-winning co-creator of Love & Rockets - the series that defined alternative comics - comes SLOTH, Hernandez's first original graphic novel, presented in breathtaking black and white by Vertigo. Troubled teenager Miguel Serra becomes a walking urban legend after he wills himself into a coma and wakes up one year later virtually unchanged - except for his sloth-like pace. Discover how a haunted lemon orchard, a mysterious goatman and murder collide as Miguel, his girlfriend Lita and their friend Romeo take on the teenage wasteland of suburbia. Will it be love or rock-and-roll suicide? Find out in SLOTH, a surrealistic romantic drama in the spirit of David Lynch that takes the art of sequential storytelling to new heights in its use of light and shadow.
name: HC/SC

description:
The 3 Geeks are back in yet another madcap romp as they take on the CGC!

See what madness ensues when an elated Allen builds a dome out of his slabbed comics and achieves 'slab enlightenment!' And what is the real secret behind the CGC? You'll never look at your graded comics the same again!
name: Slab Madness?! Part 1

description: A story about a small-town terorized and an Earth Elemental's quest for redemption.
name: OGN

description: He has become a modern legend, this mysterious creature of the Louisiana bayou. Feared as a monster, hailed as a god, by turns wonderfully benevolent and pitiless in his wrath, the Swamp Thing has carved his unique niche in the American Landscape.Writer Len Wein and legendary horror artist Bernie Wrightson, the original creators of the most complex creature in comics, brought the "Swamp Thing" to life in an 8-page story from HOUSE OF SECRETS #92. Now that classic story, plus the first ten issues of SWAMP THING Volume One, are reprinted in a new edition of SWAMP THING: DARK GENESIS - a 240-page VERTIGO trade paperback.In DARK GENESIS, learn the astonishing secret of Swamp Thing's "birth"; share the forbidden passions of Anton Arcane and the measureless sorrow of the Patchwork Man; shiver to the timeless horror of the witch named Rebecca Ravenwind and of a tortured Scottish werewolf. These eleven stories are not merely acknowledged classics of the comics field; they are an incredible reading experience, and the ideal introduction to the many-faceted creature known as Swamp Thing.
name: Dark Genesis

description:
1. Movie Hero No. 1 (Robin and Batman)

2. The Man Who Lived in 1, 000 Rooms (Captain Compass)

3. Death in a Test Tube (Federal Agent)

4. The Ransom of Dan Hunter (Tomahawk)
name: Movie Hero No. 1

description:
1. "Clark Kent's Super-Dad" (Superboy) written by Jerry Coleman, art by John Sikela. Reprinted in The Superman Family #169.
  2. "Quick Quiz" quiz by H. T. Elmo
  3. "Hy Wire" gag strip by Henry Boltinoff
  4. "The Iceberg of Doom" (Aquaman) written by Otto Binder, art by Ramona Fradon
  5. "Lionel and His Lions" gag page by Henry Boltinoff
  6. "The Make-Believe Archer" (Green Arrow) art by George Papp. Reprinted in Century: The 100 page Comic Monthly #10
name: Clark Kent's Super-Dad

description: Breaking free of his past, Fist of Justice confronts the one man who stands in the way of his return as Charm City’s greatest defender.
name: Prologue/ The Fury of Justice

description:
Overview

Picking up directly from the events in the smash hit limited series Ultimate Extinction! The Earth was saved from the Ultimate threat—Gah Lak Tus. But scientist George Tarleton has captured a piece of that awesome entity and plans to reactivate it for his own evil purposes. The only hope for mankind against this mad scheme—the strange alien being called The Vision!

Overview

The Gah Lak Tus module, an object of immense cosmic power, is now in the murderous hands of George Tarleton—leader of the sinister organization A.I.M. And with the otherworldly Vision down, nothing stands in the way of total conquest of Earth by this alien force.

Overview

The Gah Lak Tus module has landed on Earth! And nothing in man’s arsenal can even give it pause! The other-worldly Vision is our last hope, but she was designed for communication purposes, not lethal combat. Can she adapt in time, or has our poor planet run out of luck? Don’t miss it!

An A-Z compendium of the Merc with a Mouth. Everything you need to know to be ready for Dead Reckoning. Covers Deadpool's first two mini-series (Circle Chase and Sins of the Past), Deadpool 1-22, Daredevil and Deadpool annual 1998, and Deadpool and Death Annual 1999.
name: One Shot

description: In this book about faith and duty, Batman learns that not only does his nobility extend deep within his ancestry but also that some things beyond the laws of science. When a mysterious package arrives at Wayne Manor, the Dark Knight Detective discovers that he is a descendant of a Grail Knight from King Arthur's court. Now possessing the Holy Grail itself, Batman must come to terms with the ramifications of its existence while safeguarding the artifact from the denizens of attackers. Featuring the Penguin, Two-Face, Catwoman, and Ra's al Ghul, this book adds an interesting and provocative chapter to the Batman legend.
name: The Chalice

description: In the horror mystery TELL ME, DARK, a haunted man enters a world of demonic sacrifices, fallen angels and dark magic when he goes in search of his lost lover. Michael Sands's world was destroyed on the night that his girlfriend inexplicably vanished. Consumed by her memory, the lovesick man returns to England on a quest to discover the true secret behind her disappearance. But after learning that an ancient evil is responsible for his girlfriend's mysterious fate, Michael becomes trapped in a deadly game of personal betrayals and eternal damnation.

volume.name: The Books of Faerie: Auberon's Tale
The Books of Faerie: Auberon's Tale
The Books of Faerie: Auberon's Tale

description: The most popular supporting character from THE BOOKS OF MAGIC takes center stage in an exciting miniseries. Living on Earth, Molly is miserable; she's under a Faerie curse, she's left her boyfriend (Tim Hunter of THE BOOKS OF MAGIC), and her family is a nightmare. But when King Auberon of Faerie is captured by an unknown enemy, Molly is given the opportunity to return to that realm, and, possibly, to lift the spell that keeps her from leading a normal life.
name: Book 1: Twilight

volume.name: The Books of Faerie: Molly's Story

description: On her return to Faerie, Molly O'Reilly meets Briar Rose, a mysterious, long-banished fairy who may be friend or foe. But before she can rescue King Auberon, Molly must face other dangers, including a depraved dwarf, a mystic marsh, and her own cat.
name: Book 2: Iron and Thorn

volume.name: The Books of Faerie: Molly's Story

description: The miniseries starring the most popular supporting character from THE BOOKS OF MAGIC nears a spellbinding conclusion. Strangely changed by her time in Faerie, earth girl Molly O'Reilly must rescue her flitling friend Yarrow, while the mysterious exile Briar Rose confronts an angry Queen Titania. But the secret to Faerie's survival may lie with the imprisoned King Auberon, who also holds the key to lifting Molly's curse.
name: Book 3: Tearing Off their Wings

volume.name: The Books of Faerie: Molly's Story

description: The miniseries starring the most popular supporting character from THE BOOKS OF MAGIC reaches its spellbinding conclusion. While Queen Titania fights a desperate magical battle, an enchanted and transformed Molly O'Reilly must free Faerie from its oppressors - - and, in the process, decide her own fate -- with the help of the enchanted gem Twilight.
name: Book 4: The Importance of Being Evil

volume.name: The Books of Faerie: Molly's Story

description: Continued from Arcana Annual #1. In the conclusion of the monumental Vertigo Annuals event, the plans of the strange children of Free Country come to fruition and the fate of that mystical land is decided. The children of the Vertigo titles will all be changed by their experiences...and one will not return.
name: In Which Avril Mitchell Learns the Story So Far

description: Anger can fuel a man's destiny...or forever cloud it. Arthur must find his old mentor, Yoshi, if he is to save Princess Kiri's life. But his search will not be an easy one, for Yoshi is on a life-long quest to repair the legendary GEAR STATION. To find Yoshi, Arthur and his companions must first face the Kwan, an llegal underground fight club who's prize is a statue rumored to contain the mythical 23rd Gear! Can our heroes win the statue in mortal combat before the Rust Troopers catch up with them? Does the 23rd Gear even exist? Find out in the second installment of Dan Fraga's critically acclaimed THE GEAR STATION! A timeless tale seeped in the legend and lore of time's past with computer enhanced art straight from the future!
name: A Call to Adventure

description: Who is the woman called Fable? Is she friend or is she foe? And what will her pressence mean to our intrepid adventurers in their quest to find the 23rd gear? Will she stand with them against the Steam Lords, Rust Troopers and Oak Trolls that seek to block their paths? Or will Bryce, Arthur and Yoshi find her pressence a detriment to their returning to the Dominion of Souls...or to their very survival? The Gear Station kicks into high gear with it's third ground-breaking issue, featuring stunning G23 Computer Graphic Images! The comic of the future is here today: The Gear Station!
name: Crossing the Threshold

description: The climactic finale to the first Gearstation story arc! The machine known as the Gearstation is operational and the evil Steamlords want it's legendary power. If this happens, hell on earth is a certainty. See our heroes Bryce, Arthur, Yoshi, Darwin, and Fable take on a majic enhanced Drach Domo and his multitude of evil troopers! Don't miss this battle of epic proportions. The fate of the Domain is at stake. Who will win the final showdown?
name: Final Destination

description: Forget everything you THINK you know about the world of the Gear Station... Our heroes managed to finally repair the Gear Station and defeat the evil Drach Domo, but their adventure is just beginning. Now they must harness the machine's vast power to travel back in time to its very creation! Witness the world of Gear Station Prime, a dark, gothic land where technology and science reign while Majic and spirituality are outlawed. The Arcadian Wars are just on the horizon; the Dusk Mages are beginning to gather their power while they plot their return to the Pantheon of Life. Our Majic- wielding heroes are totally out of place here--and there not the only ones! An evil force has gone back in time as well, in hopes of destroying the Gear Station before itt's even built. Who is this evil force?? How does he plan to unite the Dark Mages? And just where does the Dominion of Souls figure into all of this?

MARVEL DIGITAL COMICS EXCLUSIVE Leaping out of the pages of Thunderbolts, Jason Strongbow aka American Eagle, tribal leader and former super hero, keeps the peace throughout Navajo lands. So when a super villain on the run crosses onto the rez, pursued by one of Tony Stark's Initiative teams, Strongbow must give them all a hard lesson in down-home justice.                          

SPOILERS

On the run from a back robbery, Cottonmouth flees into the Navajo reservation that is the home of Jason Strongbow, American Eagle. Jason blows off the offer of assistance from the Desert Stars, Arizona's Initiative team, and deals with Cottonmouth himself.
name: Just a Little Old Fashioned Justice

description: Gary Frank (Gen 13, Supergirl, Incredible Hulk) debuts his latest creation! Neanderthal lives among us--and someone wants to put an end to that! Meet the good guys, the bad guys, and an act of mindless savagery which will be a catalyst to all future events. Be a part of the future today as Top Cow launches what is sure to be one of the runaway hits of the new millennium!
name: Cometh The Caveman

description: An 11th-century Crusader comes to render a terrible judgment on the citizens of 21st-century San Francisco, setting off a firestorm of moral consequence in the hearts and minds of the people. This special low-priced Prestige Format one-shot of horror leads directly into the ongoing series.

Discovering that McLoon is on their side, Bob and Elspeth join forces with him just in time to prevent the government faction, which wants Bob dead, from killing Elspeth for the knowledge she possesses about the lost caveman. Plus, Elspeth's father comes in search of his missing daughter and finds out the hired serviceman he has unwillingly acquired is much more than he seems to be.
name: Friendly Fire

description: Our three heroes seem to find trouble around ever corner as their trip to Nevada takes a certain detour to the slammer! Breaking out of a small town jail cell will certainly be a first for our beloved caveman. In the meantime, Elspeth's father is still in search of his daughter and acquires yet another unique servant to help aid in his quest.
name: A Stick In Time...

description: Cain goes on trial for his murders of Abel, and both the Dreaming and the Waking pay the price in this one-shot. Abel frees Judge Gallows from the House of Mystery, and the jurist's first order of business is the trial of Cain. As characters from The Sandman and The Dreaming play their parts in the proceedings, a guilty verdict proves to be the inescapable conclusion, but no one realizes that the fate of the entire world lies in the balance.
name: Trial and Error

description: It's the climatic finale of the most intriguing new mini-series of the year as the first KIN story-arc comes to an explosive end! Bob, Elly and Cloon fight for their lives and the freedom of Bob's KIN as their struggle turns the entire Nevada SIA facility into a war zone! Will our heroes survive to reset the covenant, or will the secrets of the Neanderthal man be exposed forever? Pick it up and find out just how our most "basic" of ancestors kept themselves from becoming extinct!

Contains haunting visions of those strange siblings from THE SANDMAN, beings personifying some of the key aspects of the human condition. Herein are eerie images of Dream, Destiny, Destruction, Desire, Despair, Delirium and Death, a gallery of fierce artistic expression and diverse styles.
name: The Endless

description:
Darren Aronofsky proved himself a filmmaker to watch with his provocative debut, Pi. His follow-up, Requiem for a Dream, continued the accolades, receiving Golden Globe and Academy Award nominations. His latest accomplishment, however, comes straight to comics in the form of The Fountain, a gorgeously painted, oversized original graphic novel about the timeless truths of life, love and death.

Working with acclaimed painter Kent Williams (Blood: A Tale, Havok & Wolverine), The Fountain crisscrosses through three distinct time periods: 1535, during an ancient Mayan war; the present day, following one doctor's desperate search for the cure for cancer; and the far future through the vast exotic reaches of space. Interweaving these three periods, The Fountain follows Tomas - warrior, doctor, explorer - as he feverishly tries to beat death and prolong the life of the woman he loves.
name: One-Shot

description:
A 4-issue miniseries finds a woman seeking power over death itself. In the old, magic-infested streets of New Orleans, there is a dangerous goth subculture that even the most knowledgeable club-hoppers never get to see. But an outsider has learned all about the secret society: Plath, a fiercely beautiful young woman who has lost someone she loves to the darkest side of the city's nightlife. Ruthless and dauntless, Plath will stop at nothing to free her lover from Death's grasp...no matter what the price.

Note: Dream Of The Endless makes a non-speaking cameo in a flashback to his imprisonment by Rodrick Burgess.
name: Act I

volume.name: The Girl Who Would Be Death

description: What does it feel like to be dead? Plath discovers that the answer to her girlfriend Evangeline's question may be far stranger than she had suspected. But nothing will deter Plath from seeking revenge on the secret society called the Cirque De Necrevores and reclaiming her lost love: not the disturbing changes in her own body, nor the vision of Petrefax and the Dreaming, and certainly not the enigmatic Eblis O'Shaughnessy, envoy of the Endless.
name: Act II

volume.name: The Girl Who Would Be Death

description: When The Sandman's Eblis O'Shaughnessy, envoy of the Endless, finally confronts Plath, he must also confront his own limitations. But the opposition to Plath's plan to capture Death also comes from within as Plath struggles with supernatural forces, as well as for the loyalty of her lover Evangeline.
name: Act III

volume.name: The Girl Who Would Be Death

description:
Plath and her lover, Evangeline, face the devastating consequences that result from Plath's desire to challenge Death. One of them must make the ultimate sacrifice, leaving the other for dead in this riveting conclusion.

Note: Death Of The Endless does not physically appear in this issue, but she speaks to multiple characters via narration boxes.
name: Act IV

volume.name: The Girl Who Would Be Death

description:
One of Vertigo's first Original Graphic Novels. A painted story with real pictures woven in of a modern retelling of the Frankenstein myth. Art, fashion and cosmetic surgery becomes symbols of what is really at the heart of the beast.

Dean Motter co-wrote this story with Judith Dupré, while the art was completely created by Sean Phillips.

Just when Marc Mason thought things were returning to normal, the enigmatic Professor Mistyk makes his much-requested return and he’s looking for help that only the Fist of Justice can provide! But can FOJ deliver when he discovers what he’s being asked to do?
name: A Twist of Time

description: Now that’s he’s reclaimed his role as Charm City’s defender, Fist of Justice faces his toughest opponent yet: his public image. But when our hero attends an event to woo the crowds, he finds it’s been crashed by the living dead. It’s up to FoJ and his buddy Black Light to keep them from becoming the death of the party! Guest-starring “The Living Corpse”!
name: Day of the Undead

description: In New Mexico, the team breaks into a secret military base to confiscate an alleged AIDS vaccine but uncover startling information linked to the Roswell Event! But first, The Invisibles change roles within the group, forcing King Mob to step down from his throne and make way for a new leader...
name: Black Science, Part 2: Kickin'

description:
1. Riddle of the Sphinx (Robin and Batman)

2. Trail of the Timber Thieves (Federal Agent)

3. Riddle of the Flying Dutchman II (Captain Compass)

4. The Two Faces of Tomahawk (Tomahawk)
name: Riddle of the Sphinx

description:
What price for eternal youth? In the twisted style you've come to expect, Grimm Fairy Tales present 'Puss n' Boots!' The pursuit of immortality knows no limits for some, even when it comes to family. Aunt and niece are willing to commit the ultimate act in hopes of living forever, all while trying to meet the insatiable needs of a feline statue that feeds on human souls. The mysterious Belinda shares the ancient history of the unusual statue, a story so compelling that it propels niece against aunt toward the story's horrifying conclusion!

Note: Cleopatra appears only on the cover.
name: Puss In Boots

description: For years fans have demanded to see more of Jill Thompson's Little Endless, the diminutive versions of the characters from Neil Gaiman's award-winning series THE SANDMAN. Now those dreams are fulfilled with a new printing of the sold-out Prestige Format one-shot THE LITTLE ENDLESS STORYBOOK in a deluxe hardcover format. The story begins once upon a time when Little Delirium was lost. Her protector and favorite puppy Barnabas searched the waking world for his tiny princess to no avail. Now, Barnabas must travel to the strange and unlikely realms of each of the Endless to see if Delirium's siblings have seen their missing sister. Cameos by the Sandman, Desire and the other members of the Endless family make this a must-have for any Sandman enthusiast. This 56-page hardcover is written and exquisitely painted by Eisner-Award winner and fan-favorite SANDMAN artist Jill Thompson. The new material in this hardcove will include a special sketchbook section and an advance look at Thompson's latest Manga project, THE DEADBOY DETECTIVES, scheduled for a summer 2005 release.

This unique mini-hardcover contains the most memorable quotes from Neil Gaiman's THE SANDMAN series, accompanied by masterful renditions of Morpheus and the rest of the Endless, contributed by a remarkable ensemble of artists.
The time-travel adventures of a brilliant, but utterly mad, scientist in Victorian London threaten to unhinge reality in an incredible, whimsical miniseries.

volume.name: The Remarkable Worlds of Professor Phineas B. Fuddle

description: Here's a scan of the origin issue.
name: origin

description: Storm is propelled several years in the time line and now finds himself in a whole new culture. It takes a while for him to find out where he is, but he quickly finds out this is the future of the earth. A barbaric culture where he now must survive, but he always tries to get back to where he came from.
name: Commandant Grek

description:
After the failed mission to the Red Spot of the planet Jupiter, Storm returns back to Earth to discover that it is no longer the earth that he left. There is nothing anymore that he recalls from the past. He is in an unknown world without oceans and seas. It is as if the prehistoric returned. Primitive peoples, bizarre and exotic animals have dominion over the earth.

Storm is captured by barbarians and brought to a city. In prison he meets Redhair, whom apparently belongs to other people. Together they escape, chased by the chief of the barbarians, to an underground power station which is run by one of the old mandroïden. He tells them that the natural world has changed and why the oceans and seas are gone. The barbarian chieftain, however, followed them. He destroyes the central computer which causes all the water of the oceans and seas to be pumped back to the top with disastrous consequences.
name: De Diepe Wereld

story_arc_credits.name: De kronieken van de Diepe Wereld

first_appearance_storyarcs.name: De kronieken van de Diepe Wereld

description:
Although the oceans and seas are returned to earth, Storm is in a different world than the world he knew before his departure to Jupiter. That feeling will not go away until he knows exactly what happened to the earth and the inhabitants of the earth.

When Storm and Ember are recruited by the traveling circus master Cush they are unwillingly dragged into an adventure that above all makes clear what bond has grown between Storm and Ember in a short time.
name: De Laatste Vechter

story_arc_credits.name: De kronieken van de Diepe Wereld

first_appearance_storyarcs.name: De kronieken van de Diepe Wereld

description: After escaping the Palace in the previous issue, Storm and Red Hair find themselves in a deadly salt desert where they encounter an escaped slave. He gets recaptured and Storm and Ember are taken along for good measure. The slave camp is set up by a scientist trying to breed a new human species capable of surviving in the salt desert and finds Ember to be a perfect specimen for experimentation...
name: Het Volk van de Woestijn

story_arc_credits.name: De kronieken van de Diepe Wereld

first_appearance_storyarcs.name: De kronieken van de Diepe Wereld

description: Storm and Ember lose each other in a giant forest. They are imprisoned and end up in a futuristic city where it appears that the earth was conquered long ago by an alien race, the Azuriëns. The Azuriëns have erased all the knowledge that was ever collected by the humans and are keeping barbarism alive. Before the knowledge of Storm and Ember is cleared as well, they manage to escape but they're not out of the woods yet.
name: De Groene Hel

story_arc_credits.name: De kronieken van de Diepe Wereld

first_appearance_storyarcs.name: De kronieken van de Diepe Wereld

description: Storm and Ember have discovered that the Earth was conquered by an alien race who cast humanity back in his development. Luckily there seems to be a resistance against the oppressors. Storm succeeds by his knowledge of technology in order to give new impetus to the opposition and thus to allow a major uprising. In the ensuing war, the technologically superior Azuriëns are out manouvered and led by Storm begins reconstruction by humankind, supported by Azuriën immigrants who want to make their new home in harmony with humankind.
name: De Strijd om de Aarde

story_arc_credits.name: De kronieken van de Diepe Wereld

first_appearance_storyarcs.name: De kronieken van de Diepe Wereld

deck: The Secret of the Nitron Rays
description:
Mankind has chased the Azuriërs off the Earth, led by Storm, Mordegai, the renegade Azuriën General Solon and Balder. An attack against the Azuriën bases on the Moon is next, and after a hard fight in space and on the ground the Earthlings manage to occupy some Azuriën bases. The Azuriëns try to blackmail Solon by threatening his parents, but the plan failes and Solon sacrifices his life so that the Earth can occupy the last Azurën Moon Base. Some Azuriën women and children are sheltering in old nitronmines where they succumb to the radiation from this ore. All except the little Azuriën girl Bitak. The child is brought over to Earth. Some Azuriëns flee into space in order to build up a pirate's life.

Storm, Mordegai and Balder celebrate the victory but trying to reconcile the people and the Azuriëns proves difficult. The Azuriëns must accept equality with humankind, and people are to be held back from exacting revenge. Benjamin, a student of Mordegai, tries to poison his master and to make Storm disappear. Then he puts the humans against the Azuriëns in a hate campaign. Storm gets Benjamin to recall the order but he manages to escape and kill Mordegai.
name: Het geheim van de Nitronstralen

story_arc_credits.name: De kronieken van de Diepe Wereld

first_appearance_storyarcs.name: De kronieken van de Diepe Wereld

description:
After the victory on the Azuriëns the new heads of state treat Storm as a mascotte and a living icon. He gets tired of this fast and decides to go back into the Red Spot on Jupiter to try and head back to his own time. Accompanied by Ember he ends up millions of years into the future in Australia.

It turns out Earth is occupied by intelligent dinosaurs who where transported from the past by an ancient peace loving society who tried to use them as defenders against barbaric invaders. That society has since then migrated to Antartica leaving the dinosaurs behind to fend for themselves.

Storm befriends their leader, Wag-Nar, when it turns out his arrival was prophesized in the legend of Yggdrasil.
name: De Legende van Yggdrasil

story_arc_credits.name: De kronieken van de Diepe Wereld

first_appearance_storyarcs.name: De kronieken van de Diepe Wereld

description: Storm and Ember reach the city in Antartica where they discover that the earth was destroyed by a massive burst of Nitron radiation shortly after he left. Despite the risks he wants to try to get back anyway. The city comes under attack though, possibly ruining his last chance to make it back to his own time.
name: Stad der Verdoemden

story_arc_credits.name: De kronieken van de Diepe Wereld

first_appearance_storyarcs.name: De kronieken van de Diepe Wereld

description:
Ember gets captured and both her and Storm end up in a rivalry between the two sons of a tribal lord. After freeing one of the sons from another tribe the two of them head to the rival brother in order to end the feud and free Ember.

The one issue in the series for which the artist Don Lawrence wrote the scenario himself.
name: De Sluimerende Dood

story_arc_credits.name: De kronieken van de Diepe Wereld

first_appearance_storyarcs.name: De kronieken van de Diepe Wereld

description: At the edge of the Cosmos, the theocrat of Pandarve Marduk, manages to transport Storm and Ember to his planet with the help of the Egg of Pandarve. The transit gets cut off right before arrival and they get seperated. Storm ends up as a slave in the water mines on one of a daughter planet of Pandarve. There he meets Nomad who helps him escape from the mines. With a group of former slaves they head for Pandarve to free Ember whos kept there by Marduk.
name: De Piraten van Pandarve

description: Storm and Nomad travel to Mardukan to free Ember from the clutches of Marduk. Ember had already freed herself just to find Storm captured instead in his efforts to free her. Marduk proclaims that because of all his time travel Storm now possesses the key to the Multiverse and Marduk intends to extract it for his own use. It's up to Ember to free Storm before Marduk succeeds.
name: Het Doolhof van de Dood

description:
Storm, Ember and Nomad end up in Aromater, a once thriving and powerful city, now in decline. For reasons unknown to them Storm turns out to be one of the chosen Seven meant to bring back the Braincoral with six others.

As it turns out, Aromater was once ruled by two brothers, the Immortal Princes. They possesed Braincoral, a mystical ore that gave them power and immortality. Under their rule, Aromater became the most powerful city on Pandarve. But one day, the two brothers got into an insurmountable argument and one of them stole with the help of zeven servants the Braincoral and left the city. They also drank the Blood of Pandarve which turns the brother into a dark demon and the servants into mindless and superstrong robots. The brother that was left behind started to age without the Braincoral and the city fell into disarray. This is why he recruited seven strong men in order to bring back that what was stolen of him

The Seven, now transformed by the Blood of Pandarve, set out to fullfill their task with Ember and Nomad in pursuit to free Storm from his mindless and potentially fatal goal.
name: De Zeven van Aromater

description: Storm, Ember and Nomad encounter an abandoned ship. It turns out the crew is devoured by a swarm of M'Anganesse insects who roams the airbubble of Pandarve. They rescue a boy from a sarcophagus who introduces himself as Renter Ka Rauw, a graduate from the famous Assassins Acadamy of Eriban. He forces the three so serve as his new crew for his graduation assignment which is to kill the King of Marrow. During their efforts to accomplish this task, the four of them end up in the deadly Barsaman tournament.
name: De Doder van Eriban

description:
Because of all of Storms' wandering around, Marduk has lost any trace of him. This is why he sends specially trained bloodhounds to all the corners of Pandarve in an effort to find him. And with success.

In a port, Storm, Ember and Nomad are looking for a buyer for the ship Renter Ka Rauw has given them. That's where one of the hounds finds them. But Marduk isn't the only one interested. A group of rebels looking to overthrow Marduk is following them as well.

They end up in the rebels' hands and the hound returns to Marduk where he turns him into a human so he can help find Storm again. This leads to a final showdown in the rebels' base, the Temple of the Vulture God, between the forces of Marduk, led by the hound, and the rebels.
name: De Honden van Marduk

description:
Storm, Ember and Nomad manage to escape Marduk yet again. With the plane of the hound of Marduk they try and find a save haven which proves difficult if you're not familiar with Pandarve.

As they fly over a sea of lava their ship is 'attacked' and dismantled by a group of dwarfs. The only way to stop the dwarfs is giving them something they want. In this case an Egg of Pandarve. While Nomad stays with them, Storm and Ember set off to find such an egg.

By chance they find out that Marduk owns one and they set out to retrieve it only to find Marduk expecting them. In Marduks palace, they suddenly get help from Mother Pandarve herself in the form of Alice in Wonderland. She needs his help as well him being the Anomaly. She wants him to battle her subconcious to which he agrees since that's also where the Eggs of Pandarve can be found.
name: De Levende Planeet

description: Storm, Ember and Nomad have found a safe yet temporay haven in a small fishing community when one day their fishing boat almost get hit by a flaming object from the sky. Upon investigation they find in the seabed a golden harnass and they decide to bring it back to the village. Back in port all hell breaks loose when the harnass comes to life. The harnass is occupied by Vandaahl de Verderver, a prisoner from another dimension banished into a black hole for his crimes who decides to carry on his path of desctruction in this new universe. Realising what they unleashed unto their brother-universe a judge that feels responsible for this mistakes travels through the black hole as well and ends up helping Storm to finally put an end to Vandaahl de Verderver.
name: Vandaahl de Verderver

description: For a thousand generations the city of Halverwege can only be reached by train through the Monuments Desert with Halverwege as it's final destination. Our familiar trio arrives there but Ember forgets her backpack in the train and heads back to retrieve it. Meanwhile a criminal called Boforce escapes prison and hijacks the train with Ember still on it. Instead of heading back, the train breaks the barrier and enters a different dimension called the Wentelwereld. Whilst Storm and Nomad pursue the runaway train through the harsh Wentelwereld, Ember is fighting an uphill battle against Boforce and her men.
name: De Wentelwereld

description:
On the planet Schuim, Storm, Ember and Nomad are drafted on the ship of Mother Krone and her sons. Once underway she turns out to be a slave hauler with her cargo hold full of childeren. The three get subdued when they find out and will be sold as well.

Her clients are a civilization of massive robots based on an artificial mini planet called Danderzei who use humans as either pets or participants in 'dogfights'. There are robots however who stand up for the humans and are basicly human rights activists. Together they start the battle to free the humans in Danderzei once and for all.
name: De Robots van Danderzei

deck: The Return of the Red Prince
description: Storm, Ember and Nomad are enjoying themselves on a fair when suddenly Nomad enters a state of trance and sets off into the distance with Storm and Ember in tow. It turns out his destination is his birth place. Nomad has been called by his dying father, the king, to take over the throne. Nomads sister Prowesse however, is dead set on claiming the throne herself and a battle for the kinddom begins.
name: De Terugkeer van de Rode Prins

description:
Mother Pandarve has a new assignment for Storm. For the last million years she has spent her time on solving the last theorem of Fermat. This distract her from a much deadlier problem: a massive astroid heading straight for the planet of Pandarve.

It's up to Storm and co, Rak*el from Danderzei, Marduk and a proxy of Pandarve to head out there and try and divert the incoming danger. They use a spaceship they had to build themselves since nobody has any experience travelling though a vacuum apart from Storm.

Once they arrive at the astroid it turns out it's a gigantic structure and obviously manmade, but by whom?
name: De Von Neumann-Machine

description: Having landed the astroid, now dubbed the Intruder, Storm and the rest venture down into the massive structure which seems to be made out of seperate cocoons, each housing a certain theme from old world history, and not withouth their dangers. Eventually they end up in Neu-London and Storm thinks visiting Sherlock Holmes will give them a good idea on how to stop the Intruder. Sherlock sends them to the central cocoon, the original one where they should be able to complete their task.
name: De Genesis-Formule

description:
While Nomad en Rak*el head for the central cocoon, Storm sends his digital twin from Danderzei into the central computer to restore the Genesis formula so the collision with Pandarve can be averted. With the help of Alice they manage to circumvent the defenses of the computer but what happens next is something nobody saw coming.

The third installment of the mini-arc involving the Intruder and intended to be something of an end for the series as a whole. It was the last issue of Storm that Don Lawrence produced before his death in 2003 two years later.
name: De Armageddon Reiziger

description:
Overview

Shape! Emil Burbank! Arcanna! And Nuke!


When four of the most powerful individuals on earth collide with their prey -- the titanic Hyperion -- the earth-shattering results are not to be missed!
 
Hyperion finds Stanley Stewart (the Blur) spying on the cave where he has been using a behavior modification device to ensure that other super-powered beings are loyal to his cause.
 
Nighthawk, along with Emil Burbank, Arcanna Jones, Shape, and Nuke, are holding a meeting when Wyatt McDonald (Black Archer) and Jim Dore (Blue Eagle) storm the building. Wyatt and Jim fall back when they realize that Nuke is present, and call for backup from Hyperion.  Nighthawk, Burbank, Jones, and Shape flee along with Kingsley. 
 
Hyperion from the normal Supreme Power universe ("Mark"), trying to decide whether or not to interfere, is confronted by the Hyperion from the dominated universe ("Hyperion"). Hyperion tells Mark that there will be no peace for him and no rest for the poor and downtrodden until he takes control of his world as Hyperion is doing. Hyperion brings Mark to the site where the second alien ship landed (which brought Zarda to Earth). The ship has grown, manifesting alien technologies. When Mark asks how Hyperion can be certain that he will also make the same decisions, Hyperion produces a piece of paper showing exactly the question which mark asked, revealing that this is a possible future of a universe very similar to, if not the same as, that which Mark came from.
 
Hyperion attempts to get Stanley to eat some food.  It has been two years that Stanley has been kept as a prisoner. Hyperion can't bring himself to use the behavior modification machine on Stanley, but he knows that he also cannot release him, and he cannot bring himself to kill him.
name: Full Circle

description:
Overview

Shape! Emil Burbank! Arcanna! And Nuke!


When four of the most powerful individuals on earth collide with their prey -- the titanic Hyperion -- the earth-shattering results are not to be missed!
 
Summary
 
Shape, Burbank, Arcanna, Nuke, and Hyperion ("Mark") have been accidentally transferred to another universe (and additionally forward in time). Hyperion in the alternate universe ("Hyperion") has been brainwashing super-powered beings to bring them under his control. He has just revealed this to Mark.
 
Hyperion, with Zarda, wants to return Mark to his normal universe, having himself visited a future possibility Hyperion who communicated the importance of control as an aspect of power years before (a role that he has just performed for Mark in issue #4). However, Mark will not voluntarily return with Shape, Burbank, Arcanna, and Nuke, whose powers brought them here in the first place.  Therefore, Hyperion decides to make himself and his Squadron of brainwashed heroes their common enemy, forcing them into a temporary alliance that will return Mark to his home dimension.
 
Hyperion sends his squad after Mark via radio communication on an open channel, knowing that Emil and his crew will pick up that information.
 
Skylark, Lamprey, Black Archer, Doctor Spectrum, and Blue Eagle team up to attack Mark. Skylark uses a sonic blast to stun him, as Lamprey siphons off a portion of his power and Black Archer uses exploding arrows. Doctor Spectrum opens up with a crystal powered blast that punches Mark into the ground.
 
The entire team backs off as Zarda comes in for the kill, plunging in to batter Mark even farther into the ground. He is knocked unconscious. Emil and Arcanna work to convince Nuke to help transport them home. Nuke is reluctant because he wants to witness Mark's death after learning that his ship was the source of the spores which gave him his powers, thereby killing innocent people through cancer and radiation poisoning, including his parents.
 
Convinced that this is the only way to return home, Nuke engages Doctor Spectrum, who is shocked to see Nuke alive again (Nuke was killed by Doctor Spectrum in this universe).  Arcanna comes to an accord with Mark to return them home, and based on Emil's calculations, they are transported back to our world with Mark consenting to their authority.
 
Arcanna and Emil present their report to General Alexander, indicating that Mark is ready to come back into the government fold. Emil tells General Alexander that he agrees with Arcanna, the quantum reality they slipped into has ceased to exist as a separate line of possibility. Emil secretly concludes that in fact the alternate reality was the future of their own timeline, based on a newspaper clipping he picked up there. He decides that the two years remaining are enough time to do what he needs to in order to be prepared for Mark's takeover.
 
Mark gives a speech reintroducing himself to the American people, saying it is good to be home again.
name: The Prodigal Son

description: Talk about a bad connection - it's a 'Two Ring Circus' when Veronica gives Archie one of her father's prototype phones, even though the matching phone is Mr. Lodge's! To get out of a jam with Veronica, Archie asks Jughead to take the blame, and 'The Blame Game' begins when the deal is doomed to failure! Mr. Lodge has to think 'Outside the Box' when he enters the toy business and discover kids almost always love the box the toys comes in best! Finally, Dilton tries to give Archie the ink blot test, but when his cards are replaced with photos of Veronica, he thinks Archie is certifiably obsessed!

Archie, Betty and Jughead decide to make extra money as personal aides, which only leads to romantic misunderstandings¸ canine chaos, garage sale mania, and 'A Yelp for Help!' It's 'Par for the Course' when a golf outing with a potential business partner turns into a golf 'ouching' for Archie! Finally, Archie laments the fact that for someone who doesn't says he's 'Lucklorn,' Jughead sure has a lot of 'good fortune!'

Archie decides to date other girls while Veronica's out of town, but while Archie flirts away, Veronica is only 'One Click Away' as her spies click away on their camera phones! Mr. Lodge has a dream - make that a nightmare - about Archie becoming a 'Teen Tycoon' and a millionaire! Finally, Archie finds the beach has gone to the dogs, especially when a little puppy follows him there. Trouble is, it's a 'no dogs allowed' beach!

Freshman Year: Part 3 of 5 - by Batton Lash & Bill Galvan 'Freshman Year: Winter Term.' In the tradition of Batman: Year One and Marvel's The Ultimates comes the biggest Archie Comics event since the 'Love Showdown!' Archie reflects on the term just past, pining over Veronica and lamenting how she went away during the holiday break. Hoping to stay close to Veronica, Archie joins the drama club - the perfect indoor activity during the frosty winter months. But being part of such a large club is hardly the way to gain exclusive quality time with Veronica. Will their reunion be everything Archie hopes, or will the eternal love triangle get off to a rollicking start with friction between Betty and Veronica instead? And will Moose ever be introduced to Midge? Other surprises in store for the gang this second term include some new faculty members as well as the departure of the expelled school bully, Jared McGerk. It's the funniest first year of high school ever, courtesy of fan-favorite writer Batton Lash of Wolff & Byrd and Archie Meets the Punisher, along with Scrapyard Detectives creator Bill Galvan!

Freshman Year: Part 5 of 5 - by Batton Lash & Bill Galvan 'Freshman Year: Spring Term.' As the first year of high school winds down, the teens anticipate the summer break - but not before having a 'Spring Formal' to send off the school year. But a few uninvited guests have crashed the dance, including an unwelcome band of bikers who have an axe to grind with the school, especially a freshman named Archie! Who are they and what is their problem? Plus, the spy in Riverdale is finally revealed! Will Mr. Weatherbee prevail? It's a thrilling way to end the school year, courtesy of fan-favorite writer Batton Lash of Wolff & Byrd and Archie Meets the Punisher fame.

'Zero Hero': Inspired by extreme skateboard star Tony Eagle and looking to help Pop Tate increase business, Archie persuades Pop Tate to open a 'skateboard wing' of the Choklit Shoppe! 'A 'Tax'-ing Situation': Cast your vote for hilarity: Mr. Andrews and Mr. Cooper sit on different sides of the fence when a new property tax to fund parks is proposed, so both of them run for town council! 'A Trust Thing': Claiming it's trust that keeps him and Veronica together, Archie can't help but be 'helpful' to the new girl in school. But can he 'trust' the new girl's boyfriend with Veronica?

Celebrate Christmas in Riverdale style! In 'A Not-So-Cool Yule' Archie has a stress-free holiday season, until both Betty and Veronica give him 'matching sweaters' that they expect him to wear, except that the designs the girls chose don't match! It's 'Cold Comfort' when Veronica thinks Archie is being chivalrous about her onion breath, when he merely has a cold! The sight of Archie with a tool kit grip Mr. Lodge and Smithers with an unspeakable in 'The Fix Is In.' And Veronica laments to Archie that 'You Never Listen,' but since he's not paying attention anyway, are her protests all for naught?

Archie need a 'Forget Me Not' when he miraculously remembers the anniversary of his first date with Veronica, but can he remember to get her a gift she doesn't already have? When Mr. Lodge's favorite artist goes abstract and creates a 'MESS-terpiece,' he suspects Archie of tampering with his paintings! When Betty keeps slipping a little 'Surprise' into Archie's back pockets, Archie wonders if he's absentmindedly taking things he shouldn't! Finally, it's 'Just Plain Wrong' when Veronica has to break a date with Archie to entertain the son of one of her father's clients, but in the end, it's Archie who makes the real power play!

'A Calculated Risk.' The timely topics of feeling pressured to excel academically and cheating to do so are addressed in this issue-length epic, filled with drama, intrigue, and of course the warmth and humor Archie Comics fans have come to expect. Which students will succumb to temptation? Will honesty and integrity triumph? There's a lesson to be learned for everyone in this important yet entertaining tale.

"Taking The Plunge!" by Mike Pellowski & Stan Goldberg, the gang takes action when they discover the old creek they used to swim in as kids is polluted. Then, Reggie's in more 'hot water' than usual when he challenges Archie to a jet ski race in "The Big Psyche" by George Gladir & Stan Goldberg. And in "Let's All Scream For Ice Cream," by Gladir & Goldberg, Archie finds out being an ice cream man isn't as "cool" as he thought it was when he fills in for the regular guy! Finally, getting your Christmas cards out early is one thing, but July is ridiculous! "It's In The Cards" by Gladir & Goldberg.

"A Grand Adventure": Archie's grandpa has a big dilemma: he's been a member of the Senior Nature Scouts for years, but until he gets a photo of himself with a wild animal, he'll only be a third class Scout! He takes the gang on a trip to the zoo to make his dreams come true, but don't forget, Archie's genes had to come from somewhere! It's animal antics as Archie's goofy grandpa puts the "oo!" back in zoo!

"It's Ap-Parent" by Bill Golliher & Stan Goldberg: Archie is totally embarrassed when his mom fills in as substitute teacher. Rest assured, Mary Andrewshas some "cute" stories to tell about her little boy! Then, Veronica let's Archie know she is tired of being seen in his "landfill" of a car! Can he give it the sheen of a dream machine? Find out in "It's Not Easy Staying Clean," by Hal Smith and Stan Goldberg!

"Lift Tift": Archie wears a jitterbug costume to a Halloween party and all the girls expect him to do "lifts" on the dance floor! When it's all over, will anyone be around to "lift" poor Archie off the floor?

"Family Matters": When a blinding snowstorm cancels Ms. Grundy's plans to visit her sister for the holiday's, she prepares for a lonely cab ride home. Instead of taking a cab, however, she runs into Archie, who not only offers her a ride from the airport, but invites her over for Christmas dinner, too! It's a heartwarming holiday tale in the true Archie tradition!
name: Family Matters

description: "Yo For It!" Archie learns being a yo-yo pro isn't the easy road to fame and fortune, it has its "ups and downs" like any job! "Once Is Enough": Archie and Reggie put France's love of slapstick comedy to the test when they take Betty and Veronica to a French restaurant for Valentine's Day!
